intro: Eurybia oporina, commonly known as the common sunflower, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow. Eurybia oporina is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
